properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Conditions will be favourable for the development of patchy frost as ground temperatures near the freezing point overnight tonight, especially in inland and low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-22T15:41:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-21T23:42:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0723916510.2019

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Ground temperatures will cool to near freezing over many regions of the Maritimes tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Brisk northerly flow will ease tonight as skies clear. Conditions will be favourable for the development of patchy frost as ground temperatures near the freezing point overnight tonight, especially in inland and low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A slow moving disturbance will continue to bring periods of rain to southern Manitoba tonight. Moderate to heavy rain redeveloped over southwestern Manitoba Saturday afternoon and is expected to gradually move to the northeast tonight. Early this evening satellite and weather radar indicated that the heavier precipitation associated with this system is taking a more northerly track. As a result portions of the northern Red River valley and the Bissett area will likely see lesser rainfall amounts and the rainfall warning has been ended for these regions. The rainfall warning remains in effect for portions of southwestern Manitoba and the southern Interlake with the rain tapering off this evening and overnight respectively. Total rainfall amounts in these areas from Thursday night to Sunday morning will likely range from 50 to 125 mm. . ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-22T15:42:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-21T23:43:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2625762307.2019
